The signs and symptoms of these disorders include tremors, rigidity, unusually slow movement (bradykinesia), involuntary muscle spasms (myoclonus), uncontrolled muscle tensing (dystonia), and an inability to carry out purposeful movements (apraxia).",GHR,GRN-related frontotemporal dementia
How many people are affected by GRN-related frontotemporal dementia ?,"GRN-related frontotemporal dementia affects an estimated 3 to 15 per 100,
